channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Devil’s Favorite Libertarian
item.description: Professional wrestler turned Tennessee local mayor Glenn Jacobs wants to reunify the conservative movement.

item.title: The U.S. accuses Maduro and his wife of ordering kidnappings, beatings and murders, among other charges
item.description: Maduro’s wife is also accused of accepting hundreds of thousands of dollars in bribes in 2007.

item.title: Venezuela still owes US energy companies billions as Trump calls for new investment
item.description: Trump wants U.S. oil companies to invest billions in Venezuela's broken infrastructure, but massive unpaid debts to American firms complicate plans.

item.title: Dan Bongino officially leaves FBI deputy director role after less than a year, returns to 'civilian life'
item.description: Dan Bongino returned to private life on Sunday, stepping down from his FBI deputy director role after less than a year on the job.

item.title: Rubio says the U.S. doesn’t need Venezuelan oil but seeks to deny adversaries control over it—and doesn’t rule out occupying the country
item.description: "What we're not going to allow is for the oil industry in Venezuela to be controlled by adversaries of the United States."

item.title: Kamala Harris blasts Trump administration’s capture of Venezuela’s Maduro as ‘unlawful and unwise’
item.description: Kamala Harris condemns Trump's capture of Venezuelan dictator Maduro as "unlawful and unwise," warning of potential chaos and questioning oil motives.

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene challenges Trump's rationale for capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro
item.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene isn't buying President Trump's explanation for why the U.S. moved to capture Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

item.title: House Democratic leader Hakeem Jeffries doubts Trump can 'run' Venezuela any better than the U.S.
item.description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries is rejecting the notion that Venezuelans will be better off now that the Trump administration is taking charge.

item.title: Second front: How a socialist cell in the US mobilized pro-Maduro foot soldiers within 12 hours
item.description: A Fox News DIgital analysis of mobilization efforts to support Maduro reveals a coordinated campaign by a transnational network of self-proclaimed soc...

item.title: The West Must Start Preparing for Ukrainian Reconstruction
item.description: It may seem premature, but the time to prepare for peace is before it arrives.

item.title: What is the Monroe Doctrine? Here’s how it has shaped U.S. foreign policy for two centuries, including Trump’s ouster of Maduro
item.description: It was intended to ward off European colonization or other interference in the Western Hemisphere. In return, the U.S. also agreed to stay out of Euro...

item.title: The Trump Administration’s Actions in Venezuela Are Constitutional
item.description: Not only was the U.S. capture of Nicolás Maduro legal, but it also has significant precedent.

item.title: Trump issues direct warning to Venezuela's new leader Delcy Rodríguez following Maduro capture
item.description: Trump reportedly warns Venezuela's new leader Delcy Rodríguez will 'pay a big price' if she resists U.S. demands following Maduro's alleged capture.

item.title: Maduro’s Last Exit to Brooklyn
item.description: The remarkable takedown of Venezuela’s dictator offers up several lessons for the region.

item.title: Venezuela’s capital Caracas is unusually quiet with stores and gas stations closed, a day after Maduro was deposed by U.S.
item.description: A day before, lines wound through stores and outside gas stations as uncertain Venezuelans stocked up on goods in case turmoil broke out.

item.title: The U.S. military emerged as a big winner after Maduro’s capture. The other sensation is this Nike outfit
item.description: "Maduro looks like a man who was on Xmas break and wearing his Nike Tech Fleece for a third straight day."

item.title: Religious Freedom in America Remains Strong, but Important Battles Lie Ahead
item.description: 2025 saw significant wins on the free exercise of religion. What will 2026 bring?

item.title: How the Monroe Doctrine factors into U.S. arrest of Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro
item.description: In detailing the U.S. military action that led to the arrest of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro, President Donald Trump referenced the Monroe Doctrin...

item.title: Sen. Tom Cotton rejects Iraq war comparison of Venezuela raid
item.description: Sen. Tom Cotton is brushing aside comparisons between the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and the 2003 operation that brought down...

item.title: U.S. intervention in Venezuela could test Trump's ability to hold GOP together in an election year
item.description: President Donald Trump's military intervention in Venezuela will pose a fresh test of his ability to hold together a restive Republican coalition duri...

item.title: Here Are The Top Six Takeaways From Jack Smith’s Preposterous White-Hat Posturing
item.description: If Smith were truly committed to transparency, he would respond to Sen. Grassley’s request for information concerning the special counsel’s investigat...

item.title: It’s Time To Cancel Our Subscription Culture Once And For All
item.description: A new cancel culture is coming. Consumerism, bad customer service, and corporations beware!

item.title: It’s Not Just Minnesota. The Vast Majority Of Daycare Is A Scam
item.description: Taxpayers have spent hundreds of billions more on completely ineffective daycare than even Somalis have been able to pilfer.

item.title: Without George Washington, America Wouldn’t Have A 250th Birthday
item.description: No one looms larger in the story of our nation's struggle for independence than George Washington, who today seems almost mythical.

item.title: The Federalist Staff’s 2025 Winners And Losers Of The Year
item.description: From winners like J.D. Vance and DOGE to losers like Jake Tapper and (also) DOGE, here are The Federalist Staff's picks for 2025.
